bill.title: An Act Relating To Strengthening Vermont's Response To Opioid Addiction And Methamphetamine Abuse
bill.description: An Act Relating To Strengthening Vermont's Response To Opioid Addiction And Methamphetamine Abuse

history.action: Committee Bill read first time
Rep. Lippert of Hinesburg moved to postpone action until 3/21/2013 which was agreed to
Read Second Time
Rep. Rep. Pugh of South Burlington spoke for the committee on Human Services
Rep. Lippert of Hinesburg moved to amend the bill which was agreed to
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 70 of 138 to Pass -- Yeas = 137, Nays = 1
Third Reading Ordered
Amendment as offered by Rep. Marcotte of Coventry, Dickinson of St. Albans Town, and O'Sullivan of Burlington agreed to
Amendment as offered by Rep. Lippert of Hinesburg agreed to
Amendment as offered by Rep. Higley of Lowell agreed to
Amendment as offered by Rep. Poirier of Barre City and Till of Jericho agreed to
Read Third time and Passed
Read 1st time & referred to Committee on Health and Welfare
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Ayer
Rules suspended & bill committed to Committee on Appropriations with the report of Committee on Health and Welfare   intact, on motion of Senator Ayer
Entered on Notice Calendar
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Health and Welfare
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Appropriations
Proposal of amendment to be offered by Senator(s) Sears
New Business/Second Reading
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Health and Welfare
Favorable report with proposal of amendment by Committee on Appropriations
Proposal of amendment to be offered by Senator(s) Sears
Read 2nd time, reported favorably with proposal of amendment by Senator Fox for Committee on Health and Welfare
Reported favorably by Senator Nitka for Committee on Appropriations with proposal of amendment
Proposal of amendment by Committee on Health and Welfare amended as recommended by Committee on Appropriations
Proposal of amendment by Senator(s) Sears; text
Consideration interrupted by recess
Consideration resumed
Proposal of amendment not agreed to
Proposal of amendment by Committee on Health and Welfare, as amended, agreed to
Senator(s) Sears motion to amend proposal of amendment; text
Proposal of amendment not agreed to
Division of the Senate 10-17
3rd reading ordered
New Business/Third Reading
Ordered to lie on motion of Senator Sears
Called up by Senator Sears & placed on action calendar for May 8, 2013
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Sears
Read 3rd time & passed in concurrence with proposal of amendment
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Campbell
Senate Proposal of Amendment concurred in with further amendment thereto, as offered by Rep. Pugh of South Burlington
House message House concurred in Senate proposal of amendment with proposal of amendment
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment
Rules suspended and bill messaged forthwith to the Senate as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Rules Suspended and Taken up for Immediate Consideration as moved by Rep. Turner of Milton
Senate Proposal of Amendment concurred in
Rules suspended & taken up for immediate consideration, on motion of Senator Baruth
House proposal of amendment to Senate proposal of amendment, text
House proposal of amendment concurred in with further proposal of amendment as moved by Senator(s) Ayer
Rules suspended & messaged to House forthwith, on motion of Senator Campbell
House message House concurred in Senate proposal of amendment to House proposal of amendment
Signed by Governor on 6/5/13

votes.desc: Shall the bill be amended as recommended by Rep. Lippert of Hinesburg?
